keyFacts: The Office of the Deputy Attorney General, at the request of Mr. Lefkowitz, intended to review aspects of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's sexual conduct involving minor victims.
A global resolution of state and federal liabilities for Epstein was established on September 24, 2007, and later modified by a letter on December 19, 2007.
A compliance deadline for Epstein under this resolution, originally set for June 2, 2008, was postponed pending the DAG's review.
The communication indicates high-level DOJ involvement and potential scrutiny of the Epstein case resolution in May 2008.
